page.title: 04THE FIGHTING COCKS
page.content: {The Fighting Cocks}is claimed to be the oldest inhabited licensed house in England. We think it was originally a fishing lodge for the monks of{St {Albans Abbey;}certainly there were fish ponds by the{River Ver,}as the name of the nearby {Fishpool Street} bears witness. The name of the public house is a reminder that there used to be a cock pit within its grounds in the days before cock fighting was made illegal.{The Fighting Cocks}is now a popular spot with local residents alike, particularly on a summer's evening when the customers overflow on to the ideal setting of the bridge over the{River Ver.}
